docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 29 -- Charges of an extensive and well-laid Communist plot for a revolution in Chile early this month are disclosed by the publication Ultimas Noticias in purported copies of secret communications from the Communist...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 29 -- Charges of an extensive and well-laid Communist plot for a revolution in Chile early this month are disclosed by the publication Ultimas Noticias in purported copies of secret communications from the Communist International at Moscow to the Communist centre of Latin-American operations at Montevideo.
docs.abstract: Dates for preliminary movements and men for leadership named in purported copies of secret communications from Communist Internatl at Moscow

headline.main: MOSCOW ACCUSED OF PLOT IN CHILE; Communist International Is Said to Have Sent Money to Help Organize Revolt. SET FOR EARLY THIS MONTH Dates and Names of Leaders for Movements in Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay Also Cited.

docs.snippet: Although United States Government bonds rallied mildly on the Stock Exchange yesterday, domestic corporation and foreign loans dipped again. THE NEW YORK TIMES average of forty domestic issues touched 64.61, compared with the low mark for the year to...
docs.lead_paragraph: Although United States Government bonds rallied mildly on the Stock Exchange yesterday, domestic corporation and foreign loans dipped again. THE NEW YORK TIMES average of forty domestic issues touched 64.61, compared with the low mark for the year to date, 64.54, touched on Feb. 10.

headline.main: FEDERAL BONDS RISE AS OTHER ISSUES DIP; Only Liberty 4 1/4 s and Treasury 4 1/4 s Fail to Go Higher in Government List. KREUGER GROUP RECOVERS Numerous Domestic Railroad, Util- ity and Industrial Obligations Decline.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 8. -- The State Department, it was said today, has no reason to believe that the French Government was responsible for yesterday's report in a Paris newspaper that the National City Bank of New York had suspended payments and...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 8. -- The State Department, it was said today, has no reason to believe that the French Government was responsible for yesterday's report in a Paris newspaper that the National City Bank of New York had suspended payments and regarded the story as so manifestly absurd that it would die a natural death.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: FORMAL organization of Communist activities in Latin America as part of Moscow's world-wide revolutionary program began shortly after the failure of the 1922 effort to disrupt Europe had convinced the authorities at the Kremlin that the fight would...
docs.lead_paragraph: FORMAL organization of Communist activities in Latin America as part of Moscow's world-wide revolutionary program began shortly after the failure of the 1922 effort to disrupt Europe had convinced the authorities at the Kremlin that the fight would be a long one which must be carried to all parts of the world.
docs.abstract: Feature article on Communist activities; illus

headline.main: COMMUNISTS IN SOUTH AMERICA HAVE FAR-FLUNG ORGANIZATION; Their Commercial and Political Agencies Are Busy in All of the Capitals, and They Have Elaborate Headquarters in Montevideo

docs.snippet: Assuming that Wall Street correctly judged yesterday's stock market, the modest advance resulted largely from a bear covering movement, inspired by uneasiness over what the proposed Congressional inquiry into short selling may disclose. Brokers who,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Assuming that Wall Street correctly judged yesterday's stock market, the modest advance resulted largely from a bear covering movement, inspired by uneasiness over what the proposed Congressional inquiry into short selling may disclose. Brokers who, presumably, were speaking for their speculative customers professed to have no concern over the impending investigation, but at the same time they ascribed the slight rally to a small-scale retreat by timid "shorts."

headline.main: News, Comment and Incidents on the Stock Exchange and in the Financial Markets.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 9 (AP). -- Chairman White of the Chaco negotiations today asked Bolivian and Paraguayan delegates to meet with him, as the neutral representative, Monday.
